application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description:
Variation of condition 2 (Approved plans) to allow revised plans and documents of planning permission 01106/W/P9 approved 27/08/2019 for the demolition of club house and associated car park and MUGA, construction of a new part 2 - part 4 storey secondary school (Use Class D1) with ancillary car parking, cycle parking, Multi-Use Games Area, hard and soft landscaping and associated works, together with improvements to Macfarlane Lane.
Conditions 6 (Construction Management and Logistics Plan), 12 (Contamination), 14 (WSI), 15 (Landscaping), 16 (Boundary Treatment), 21 (Ecology) and 22 (Tree Protection) to be varied to remove requirement for submission of details at pre-commencement and pre-above ground works trigger points and amend to require compliance in accordance with details submitted.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before 26/08/2022.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used. 

Approved plans:
External Lighting Strategy Report BOLD-ARC-ZZ-XX-RP-EE-0001-P04 dated March 2017 prepared by Arcadis, BREEAM Pre-assessment prepared by Arcadis Version 1.1 dated March 2017, Ventilation Statement prepared Arcadis BOLD-ARC-ZZ-XX-RP-ME-0002-P03 dated March 2017, Preliminary UXO Risk Assessment prepared by 1st Line Defence EP3810-00 dated 17/07/13, Phase 1 Ground Contamination Desk Study prepared agb Environmental P2718.3.1 dated  30 March 2017, Statement of Community Involvement prepared by Forty Shillings dated March 2017, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal prepared by agb Environmental P2718.1.2 dated 30 March 2017, Site Sequential Assessment prepared by Cushman & Wakefield dated March 2017, M&E Utilities Feasibility Study prepared by Arcadis Revision 02 dated 03/01/17, Air Quality Assessment prepared by Aether AQ assessment/2017/MacFarlane_2017update dated March 2017, Landscape and Visual Impact Assessment prepared by Liz Lake Associates 1907 LVIA 17 03 30.docx dated March 2017, Flood Risk Assessment 14649-Y-FRA-001-R2  dated 29 March 2017, Transport Assessment prepared by Local Transport Projects LTP/16/2504 Final Issue 1 [Appendix 2 superseded] dated March 2017.
BA-A-0001 Rev C, BA-A-0002 Rev C, BA-A-1205 Rev A, BA-A-2008 Rev A, BA-A-9001 Rev C, BA-A-9002 Rev C, BA-A-9003 Rev C, BA-A-9004 Rev C. 
Drainage Assessment Form Version 3, Drainage Strategy prepared Arcadis BOLD-ARC-00-XX-RP-DE-0001-05 dated March 2017, Environmental Noise assessment prepared by South Downs Environmental Consultants 2072W-SEC-00002-02 [Issue 02 Final] dated May 2017. BOLD-ARC-00-XX-DR-DE-0001 Rev 04, BOLD-ARC-00-XX-DR-DE-0002 Rev 04, BOLD-ARC-00-XX-DR-DE-000

Condition : 3 - The premises shall be used for a school and for no other purpose (including any other purposes in Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work on any phase shall take place on the site except between the hours of 0800 to 1800 on Monday to Friday and 0900 to 1300 on Saturdays and none shall take place no Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - The approved Construction Logistics Management Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction period.

Condition : 7 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved the applicant shall have entered into a legal agreement with the council to construct highway works around the site as generally shown on drawing numbers LTP/204/T1/08.01, LTP/2504/T1/08.02, and LTP/2504/T1/09.02. The works shall be constructed in accordance with details that shall be submitted to and approved by the council and made available for use prior to first occupation of the development.

Condition : 8 - Prior to occupation of the building, a Travel Plan that includes proactive targets, measures and an action plan to reduce car travel, particularly car borne staff trips, and targets for modal share shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Travel Plan shall be brought into effect when the school first opens and shall continue in permanent operation thereafter.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:
- Cycle parking
- A Car Park Management Plan
- Vehicle Charging Points
- A Delivery and Servicing Management Plan (including coach management)
- An Out of Hours Special Events Plan
The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the site and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Condition : 10 - The car parking shown on the approved plans shall be installed on the site prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Condition : 11 - All deliveries and servicing shall take place within the site. No loading or unloading shall be undertaken on the public highway.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Phase 2 Ground Investigation ref. P2718.4.0 dated 7 April 2017 prepared by agb Environmental Ltd, Geo-Environmental Report ref. 18-1580.01 dated February 2019 prepared by Delta-Simons and Remediation Strategy ref. 18-1580.02 dated January 2020 prepared by Delta-Simons.

During the course of the development:
c. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 
Before the development is first brought into use:
d. The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 13 - Prior to commencement of development the final detailed drainage designs and associated full drainage maintenance plan shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include:
-  Evidence as to which above ground SuDS features will be included in the drainage scheme
- Calculations that demonstrate that site drainage scheme aligns with Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems. Specifically S7, S8 and S9
- A maintenance and adoption plan for the proposed drainage scheme including all elements.
The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the site and limit surface water runoff from the site to 5 l/s.

Condition : 14 - The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved written scheme of investigation (WSI) Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Excavation ref. 16/P1968 dated September 2019 prepared by Pre-construct Archaeology Ltd and the Archaeological Evaluation ref. BOE19 dated May 2019 prepared by Pre-Construct Archaeology Ltd.

Prior to occupation of the development hereby permitted evidence in the form of a validation report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that all archaeological works have been completed in accordance with the WSI.

Condition : 15 - The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the landscaping details hereby approved and maintained in accordance with the approved maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development.
All landscaping in accordance with the approved scheme shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following completion of construction works.

Condition : 16 - The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the boundary treatment details hereby approved; the boundary treatment shall be implemented before the building is occupied and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 17 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 18 - a) Within six months of work starting on site a BREEAM New Construction 2014, Fully Fitted Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.
b) With six months of the first occupation of the building(s) a BREEAM New Construction 2014, Fully Fitted Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 19 - Prior to any school buildings being occupied, evidence shall submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the proposed scheme for mitigation against noise is compliant with requirements of BB93 (2015) for all teaching spaces, including any spaces for pupils with special needs. Suitable noise tests shall be carried out that demonstrate compliance with the above standard, including reverberation time measurement.
 (Note: noise tests shall be conducted with windows partially open, unless alternative ventilation e.g. mechanical ventilation is required in locations with high noise levels, where windows should be closed & ventilation switched-on).

Condition : 20 - Any fixed external plant shall be designed and installed to ensure that noise emanating from such plant is at least 10dB below the background noise levels when measured from the nearest sensitive receptors. All plant shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans. No further fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the written prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 21 - The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the recommendations set out in the approved  Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (Ref. P2718.1.2 dated 30 March 2017) and the Pre-Commencement Badger Survey Report ref. 18-2004.01 dated 26th November 2019 prepared by Delta-Simons.
 b)	No part of the development shall be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (Ref. P2718.1.2 dated 30 March 2017) and the Pre-Commencement Badger Survey Report ref. 18-2004.01 dated 26th November 2019 prepared by Delta-Simons.
All the measures integrated, shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.

Condition : 22 - The proposed development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment (ref. Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Arboricultural Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan 7344 dated 15/4/2019 prepared by Hayden's Arboricultural Consultants).
All the tree work shall be carried out in accordance with BS3998:2010 - Tree Work - Recommendations. The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree or hedge shall be carried out in complete accordance with BS5837:2012, before any equipment, machinery, or materials are brought onto the site for the purposes of development or other operations.  The fencing shall be retained intact for the full duration of the development until all equipment, materials and surplus materials have been removed from the site.  If the fencing is damaged all operations shall cease until it is repaired in accordance with the approved details.  Nothing shall be stored or placed in any fenced area in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavations be made without the written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 23 - Prior to occupation of the building all road improvement works to Macfarlane Lane as shown generally on drawing number LTP/25604/T1/09.01 are to be constructed to an adoptable standard in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and made available for use prior to first occupation.

Condition : 24 - Prior to occupation of the building a scheme to provide street lighting along the footpath linking Grant Way to Macfarlane Lane to the rear of the Tesco store is to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The school shall not open until the lighting has been installed and brought into use.

Condition : 25 - Prior to occupation of the building an Access Management Strategy is to be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved strategy shall be brought into use as soon as the School opens and shall be kept in operation permanently thereafter.
